posts.title: django-upload-image
posts.text: Upload Image in DjangoUsing ImageField. To properly use it, you should store the image file in static folder, and record the path in database. modelThe code below will modify the upload path and change the file name to a random string. 12345def on_upload(instance, name): return os.path.join('static/image/', uuid.uuid1().hex+'.'+name.split('.')[-1])class ImageUploader(models.Model): image = models.ImageField(upload_to = on_upload) viewletâ€™s use django class view. First create a instance of the model, then save the image to disk. The view will return the proper path where static folder is served under /.12345class ImageUpload(ViewClass): def post(self): img = ImageUploader.objects.create(image=self.request.POST['image']) img.save() return settings.get_url()+img.image.url[7:]
